column1: ungwë is a noun meaning "spiders web" in Quenya.
Image:Ungwe.gifUngwë is also the name in Quenya of the eighth letter of the Tengwar alphabet. It is the fourth letter of the second grade or Tyellë
column2: which contains "voiced stops" and it is the first letter in the fourth series of consonants. For written Quenya or Sindarin
column3: the fourth series is used for the labialized or kw-series
column4: the Quessetéma. In the standard spelling of Quenya
column6: Note while in Sindarin this letter represents GW. In Westron the fourth series is used for the k-series
column8: and this letter represents G. The Westron name for this letter is Gá.See Westron Tengwar

column1: The word derives from the Primitive Quendian Sundocarme UÑG.
